meanings.definition: (verb) to produce a quavering or warbling sound by rapidly alternating the pitch of a note
meanings.sent1: The bird trilled a beautiful song in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She trilled a happy tune on her flute.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel trilled a warning to its friends about the approaching cat.
meanings.sent4: The wind trilled through the leaves, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: His laughter trilled through the room, filling it with joy.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having a trill or quavering sound
meanings.sent1: The trilled notes of the piano echoed in the hall.
meanings.sent2: Her voice had a trilled quality that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent3: The trilled sound of the wind chimes made the garden feel magical.
meanings.sent4: The trilled laughter of the children filled the playground with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The trilled call of the bird added a musical touch to the forest.

meanings.sent1: The trilled of the songbird filled the air with melody.
meanings.sent2: The trilled of the flute added a magical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The trilled of the phone notification interrupted the silence of the room.
meanings.sent4: The trilled of the waterfall sounded like nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The trilled of the wind in the canyon created a peaceful atmosphere.
